p: The concentration–response curve for the effect exerted by EO S against tracheal rings precontracted with ACh (10 μM) and preincubated with the calcium-activated K + (K Ca) channel blocker tetraethyl ammonium chloride (TEA), is shown in Figure 4, in comparison with the curve of the control. The two curves were almost superimposed, indicating that the inhibition of the K Ca channel was not a significant signaling pathway.
